title: Mortefontaine, Oise
text:
Mortefontaine is a <a href="Communes%20of%20France">commune</a> in the <a href="Oise">Oise</a> <a href="Departments%20of%20France">department</a> in northern <a href="France">France</a>.
The castle of Mortefontaine was bought by <a href="Joseph%20Bonaparte">Joseph Bonaparte</a>, elder brother of <a href="Napol%C3%A9on%20Bonaparte">Napoléon Bonaparte</a>, in 1798. The <a href="Convention%20of%201800">Convention of 1800</a> (also known as the Treaty of Mortefontaine), a treaty of friendship between France and the United States of America was signed in the castle of Mortefontaine. The preliminaries of the 1802 <a href="Peace%20of%20Amiens">Peace of Amiens</a> were also negotiated at the castle.
